choices.A: Standard CTI Reception of SRTP Key Material

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
If a subscriber wants to call in to check voice mail from any off-net location (such as home or a cell phone) and to be presented only with the PIN login menu (and not the User ID followed by PIN login menu), then Cisco Unity Express must recognize the caller ID delivered with the PSTN call and be able to map that to a mailbox on the system. This call flow requires the following:

•The PSTN must deliver caller ID to your location.

•You must associate a secondary number (the PSTN phone number) with the mailbox in addition to the extension.

You can associate a secondary number with a Cisco Unity Express mailbox by setting the Primary E.164 Number field in the user's profile to this number 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/unity_exp/design/design21/cuedg21/cuevmdes.html#wp1008337

questions.question_text: A user encounters a problem while checking voicemail, set up in a Cisco UCME and Cisco Unity Express integration. The user reports that when calling the office number from a mobile phone, the call goes to voicemail, but it is then routed to the main menu rather than the voicemail box. The user can check voicemail from an office phone without any issues. How is this issue fixed?

choices.D: Set "Login without PIN" to "No" for the user.
choices.C: Configure a primary E.164 number for the user.
choices.B: Add the user to Cisco Unity Express.
choices.A: Assign the user to the correct user group.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Yes - C

https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/voice_ip_comm/connection/1x/user/guide/ug160.html

Alternate greeting

Enable this greeting to play during a specific time period when you want to indicate special circumstances, such as when you are on vacation. (For example, "I will be out of the office until <date>.")

When it is enabled, the alternate greeting overrides all other greetings.

Holiday greeting

Enable this greeting if you want Connection to play a special greeting during a holiday. (For example, "Happy holiday. I am not available to answer your call. I will be out of the office from <date> to <date>.")

When it is enabled, the Holiday greeting overrides the standard greeting during nonbusiness hours.

Selected Answer: C
I think correct answer is C

questions.question_text: An engineer needs to configure individual call handler greetings on Cisco Unity Connection so that a single greeting can override all other greetings set by users during a holiday period. Which type of greeting should be configured to accomplish this goal?
An administrator needs to prevent toll fraud in Cisco Unity Connection. Which action should be taken to accomplish this task?

choices.B: set up class of restriction in the Cisco IOS Voice Gateway
choices.A: assign a CSS that does not have calling rights to the caller extension
choices.C: set up all restriction tables to prevent calls to the operator
